p: Generally, respiratory viruses are transmitted between humans by the following routes: direct or indirect contact to infected persons, via droplets, or by aerosols. The main route for each virus differs and is still in discussion ( Kutter et al., 2018). In case of zoonotic MERS-CoV infection, the consumption of uncooked meat or milk from or direct contact to infected animals are other suspected routes ( Song et al., 2019). Control of the transmission of respiratory infections may be partly achieved through adequate hygiene practices and avoidance of congregation and stress.
